Grain.Do: Quinoa (1 cup cooked), Basmati Rice (1 cup cooked), Oats (1/2 cup dry), Barley (1 cup cooked). Focus on cooling grains.
Grain.Dont: Spicy grains, fried grains, excessive whole wheat if it causes heat.

Legume.Do: Mung Dal (1/2 cup cooked), Lentils (1/2 cup cooked), Chickpeas (1/2 cup cooked). Opt for easily digestible dals.
Legume.Dont: Heavy beans like kidney beans, black beans in large quantities.

Veg.Do: Cucumber (1 cup sliced), Zucchini (1 cup cooked), Broccoli (1 cup steamed), Sweet Potato (1/2 cup cooked). Cooked vegetables are generally better for weight gain.
Veg.Dont: Extremely pungent or spicy vegetables like radishes, hot peppers. Avoid raw vegetables in excess if digestion is weak.

Spices.Do: Coriander, Cumin, Fennel, Cardamom, Turmeric. Mild, cooling spices.
Spices.Dont: Chili peppers, mustard seeds, black pepper in excess. Avoid very heating spices.

Leafy veg.Do: Spinach (1 cup cooked), Swiss Chard (1 cup cooked), Kale (1 cup cooked). Cooked leafy greens are preferred.
Leafy veg.Dont: Raw leafy greens in large amounts, bitter greens like arugula if too heating.

Oil.Do: Ghee (1-2 tbsp), Coconut Oil (1-2 tbsp), Olive Oil (1-2 tbsp). Healthy fats to support weight gain and cool Pitta.

Fruits.Do: Sweet Mango (1 cup), Grapes (1 cup), Pears (1 medium), Melons (1 cup). Naturally sweet and cooling fruits.
Fruits.Dont: Sour fruits like unripe bananas, citrus fruits in excess (can increase acidity).

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Almonds (soaked, 5-7), Walnuts (3-4), Dates (2-3). These are grounding and nourishing.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Pistachios and cashews in excess (can be heating). Avoid dry fruits if they cause digestive issues.

Milk product.Do: Ghee (already mentioned), Sweet Lassi (1 cup), Yogurt (1/2 cup, diluted or blended with water). Dairy can be grounding and nourishing.
Milk product.Dont: Sour or old yogurt, excessive cheese.

Condiments.Do: Mild chutneys made with cooling fruits, dates or coconut. Herbal teas (mint, chamomile).
